oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bovine spongiform encephalopathy (B.S.E.): A new disease?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pinsent, P. J. N.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine spongiform encephalopathy
Brain
cattle diseases
Nervous system diseases
Pathology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This disease is probably a genuinely new disease. It apparently only exists in Great Britain, and it seems unlikely that it was present in this country before 1984. It is a slowly progressive encephalopathy of adult cattle producing, microscopically, a spongiform appearance of sections of brain tissue. It runs a relatively lengthy course which invariably ends in death. It is probably due to an “unconventional viral” agent similar to that of scrapie.
